newsitem.title: UK: ONS outlines UK June RPI outlook.
newsitem.headline: ONS outlines UK June RPI outlook.

text.p: Britain's Office for National Statistics offered the following outlook for retail price inflation in June.

-- It said seasonal food prices tend to fall in June and July, while an upward revision to the Green pound should subdue agricultural prices a little, although the proportional effect on RPI will be somewhat reduced.

-- Housing costs will be pushed upwards in June, after most major mortgage lenders increased their rates after base rate rises on May 6 and June 6. Existing borrwers will see home loan costs rise on June 1 and July 1.
-- Coal and solid fuel prices tend to fall in June due to seasonal discounting.
-- June traditionally sees the start of household goods and clothing and footwear sales although the ONS noted household goods prices actually rose in June last year.
-- British Telecommunications Plc cut prices on certain calls on May 29. That will affect the June index. But residential line rentals will rise on July 1, the ONS said.
-- Rail fare increases may come from certain companies in June.
